ratings.comment: Professor Carlson gives clear lectures that are great for taking notes. The tests only grade off of the lectures so super easy to study for. She is quite helpful and willing to help in hard situations. Heavily suggest taking her for a class.
This class was pretty easy and interesting. I learned a lot about family life, and lecture attendance isn't required. We did have a textbook, but you don't need to read it to understand the content.
This class was super interesting and really easy. TA was difficult to get in contact with but that was the only downside. Overall such an amazing professor and really cares about her students!

She is super nice and helpful. Overall, the class is fairly easy as everything on the exams is taken from the lecture notes. No need to read the assigned material, everything in the chapter is covered during lecture.

This professor was fine. Didn't find lectures super engaging or interesting. It's a good class for a sociology credit but the professor just reads off of the slides. Lectures are posted and attendance wasn't mandatory so it was easy to do well. Exams are very fair and reflection papers are easy as well.

I absolutely loved this class. Professor Carlson was so caring and super approachable. You are graded on a few written reflections, five quizzes, and three exams (including the final). I would absolutely take one of her classes again.

Professor Carlson is accomplished and passionate about her area of expertise. I took her course to satisfy a pre-med requirement, and she was willing to work with me to make the course fit my needs and truly cares about her students and their success. Her lectures are meticulously crafted and current, which made the content so interesting!

Prof Carlson is super nice and overall a good teacher. She assigns quite a bit of reading, and even though there are reading quizzes, you don't really have to read as long as you attend lecture and go over notes. There are two exams, which are MC, T/F, two short essays, and one long essay. There's also one 8 page paper on a topic of your choice

Marcy is a pretty good professor, though her lectures tend to be a little dry. Interesting, sad material that is hard to make exciting though. Quizzes are announced ahead of time, but you will need to read the material to pass them. One 8-10 page paper on a topic of your choice. A lot of T/F that were way trickier than necessary.

Marcy is very knowledgable about the topic. She teaches Poverty, Inequality, and Social Policy. There are a lot of readings assigned every night and 5 quizzes on those readings (the lowest gets dropped). The exams aren't hard, it's just that we learn a LOT of information so it's difficult to gauge what to know and how to study, especially for MC.
